JUMPY
  • LIST OF USED SOURCES

User Guide for "JUMPY!" Game

References Used in Development:

  • DaFluffyPotato's Python Game Development Tutorial:

    I used the video titled "How to make a game in Python" by DaFluffyPotato as a reference for creating code for my graduation project. The video was instrumental in inspiring various aspects of my work. While I drew significant inspiration from it, I adapted and personalized the concepts to better suit my project requirements, resulting in a more customized implementation that reflects my own coding style and ideas.

  • Green Pixels Pixel Art Assets:

    For my game, I utilized pixel art assets from Green Pixels as enemy characters. I chose to use these assets because I am not a graphic designer, and they fit the aesthetic and theme of my game perfectly. This allowed me to focus more on the programming and gameplay mechanics aspects of the project.

  • BowPixel's Low Grass Set:

    For enhancing the visual appeal of my game, I incorporated the Low Grass Set from BowPixel. This flower set was selected to add depth and beauty to the game environments. As I am not a graphic designer, using these ready-made, high-quality assets allowed me to achieve a professional look and feel without needing to create the graphics from scratch.

  • GraphScriptDev's Plant Trees Set:

    In addition to enhancing the game's visual environment, I also utilized the Plant Trees set from GraphScriptDev. This set of tree assets was chosen to complement the floral elements previously added and to bring more life and natural aesthetics to the game landscapes. As I am not a graphic designer, using these well-crafted assets was crucial in developing a visually appealing and cohesive environment without the need to design them myself.

  • Cainos's Pixel Art Platformer Village Props:

    To further enrich the environmental detail in my game, I utilized the Pixel Art Platformer Village Props from Cainos. These props provided a variety of thematic elements that greatly enhanced the village scenes within the game. Opting to use these ready-made assets allowed me to focus more intensively on the coding aspects of the project, sparing me the complexities of graphic design which is not my primary expertise.

  • Cave-Themed Background Assets:

    For the backgrounds in my game, I utilized free-to-use cave-themed assets. These assets provided the necessary atmospheric depth and thematic consistency needed for the cave sections of the game. By incorporating these publicly available resources, I was able to enhance the game's visual environment while focusing my efforts more on the game's programming and mechanics.

  • Monles Yen's Pygame Tutorial on Medium:

    In developing my platformer game, I utilized a tutorial by Monles Yen on Medium. This tutorial served as an inspirational resource, offering deeper insights into the game development process with Pygame. It provided a more thorough explanation of the concepts introduced in the original video I watched, helping me better understand the underlying mechanics and programming techniques. The tutorial was not followed step-by-step but was crucial for enhancing my comprehension of how everything works, allowing me to more effectively adapt and apply these ideas in my own project.

  • Overflow Community:

    I would also like to extend my thanks to the Overflow community for their invaluable assistance throughout the development of my game. I encountered numerous challenges and errors along the way, and it was often the insights and solutions provided by community members on Overflow that helped me resolve these issues. Their support was crucial in enabling me to move forward with my project successfully. I deeply appreciate the collaborative spirit and expertise of the community that contributed significantly to the refinement and functionality of my game.

  • KidsCanCode's Video Tutorial:

    I also gained valuable ideas and knowledge from a video tutorial by KidsCanCode. The tutorial provided practical insights into game development techniques, which were instrumental in shaping some of the features and functionalities of my game. I am grateful for the clear and comprehensive explanations offered, which enhanced my understanding and application of game development concepts.

  • Pygame Official Documentation:

    A substantial portion of my project development was facilitated by the official Pygame documentation. This comprehensive resource served as a guide, providing essential references and explanations that enabled me to utilize various features and functionalities of the Pygame library effectively. From understanding key concepts to implementing specific functionalities, the Pygame documentation played a crucial role in navigating and overcoming challenges encountered during the development process. I am grateful for the detailed documentation, which greatly contributed to the successful completion of my project.
